sub_topic: The construction of the Cantor set.
message_1: In the construction of the Cantor set, if we start with a line segment of length 9 and remove the middle third (of length 3) in each iteration, how long will the remaining line segments be after the 5th iteration?
message_2:
In the Cantor set construction, we start with a line segment of length 9 and remove the middle third in each iteration. After each iteration, the remaining line segments are 1/3 of their previous length. 

After the 1st iteration, the remaining line segments have a total length of (2/3) * 9 = 6.
After the 2nd iteration, the remaining line segments have a total length of (2/3) * 6 = 4.
After the 3rd iteration, the remaining line segments have a total length of (2/3) * 4 = 8/3.
After the 4th iteration, the remaining line segments have a total length of (2/3) * 8/3 = 16/9.
After the 5th iteration, the remaining line segments have a total length of (2/3) * 16/9 = 32/27.

So, after the 5th iteration, the remaining line segments have a total length of 32/27.
